member.name: M:GameOverlay.Windows.WindowHelper.FindChildWindow(System.IntPtr,System.String,System.String,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Searches for the first child window matching the search criterias.
member.param: A window handle.
The window title of the child window. Can be null.
The window class of the child window. Can be null.
A handle to a child window. The search begins with the next child window in the Z order. The child window must be a direct child window of hwndParent, not just a descendant window.
member.returns: Returns the matching window handle or IntPtr.Zero if none matches.

member.name: M:GameOverlay.Windows.WindowHelper.FindWindow(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Searches for the first window matching the given parameters.
member.param: The window name. Can be null.
The windows class name. Can be null.
member.returns: Returns the matching window handle or IntPtr.Zero if none matches.

member.name: M:GameOverlay.Windows.WindowHelper.GetActiveWindow
member.summary: Retrieves the window handle to the active window attached to the calling thread's message queue.
member.returns: The return value is the handle to the active window attached to the calling thread's message queue. Otherwise, the return value is NULL.

member.name: M:GameOverlay.Windows.WindowHelper.GetClassLong(System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves the specified value from the WNDCLASSEX structure associated with the specified window.
member.param: A window handle.
The index can be a byte offset or one of the defined constants.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is the requested value.

member.name: M:GameOverlay.Windows.WindowHelper.GetDesktopWindow
member.summary: Retrieves a handle to the desktop window. The desktop window covers the entire screen. The desktop window is the area on top of which other windows are painted.
member.returns: The return value is a handle to the desktop window.

member.name: M:GameOverlay.Windows.WindowHelper.GetFirstChildWindow(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Returns the first child window of the specified parent window if it has one.
member.param: A window handle. IntPtr.Zero for the desktop window.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is a window handle. If no window exists with the specified relationship to the specified window, the return value is NULL.

member.name: M:GameOverlay.Windows.WindowHelper.GetFirstWindow(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Returns the window with the highest position in the Z order relative (Topmost or not) to the given handle.
member.param: A window handle. IntPtr.Zero for the desktop window.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is a window handle. If no window exists with the specified relationship to the specified window, the return value is NULL.

member.name: M:GameOverlay.Windows.WindowHelper.GetForegroundWindow
member.summary: Retrieves a handle to the foreground window (the window with which the user is currently working). The system assigns a slightly higher priority to the thread that creates the foreground window than it does to other threads.
member.returns: The return value is a handle to the foreground window. The foreground window can be NULL in certain circumstances, such as when a window is losing activation.

member.name: M:GameOverlay.Windows.WindowHelper.GetLastWindow(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Returns the window with the lowest position in the Z order relative (Topmost or not) to the given handle.
member.param: A window handle. IntPtr.Zero for the desktop window.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is a window handle. If no window exists with the specified relationship to the specified window, the return value is NULL.

member.name: M:GameOverlay.Windows.WindowHelper.GetNextWindow(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Returns the window below the specified window in the Z order.
member.param: A window handle. IntPtr.Zero for the desktop window.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is a window handle. If no window exists with the specified relationship to the specified window, the return value is NULL.

member.name: M:GameOverlay.Windows.WindowHelper.GetOwnerWindow(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Returns the owner window of the specified window if it exists.
member.param: A window handle. IntPtr.Zero for the desktop window.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is a window handle. If no window exists with the specified relationship to the specified window, the return value is NULL.

member.name: M:GameOverlay.Windows.WindowHelper.GetPreviousWindow(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Returns the window above the specified window in the Z order.
member.param: A window handle. IntPtr.Zero for the desktop window.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is a window handle. If no window exists with the specified relationship to the specified window, the return value is NULL.
